title: Ezreal, Yet Again the Bane of Junglers
body:
Because of Mid Lane Ezreal, Runeglaive is being nerffed in the PBE by having its AoE not activating unless it hits a Jungle Camp. This wouldn't annoy me if it weren't for 2 factors. 
1) That it's only Ezreal and yet Riot feels they need to nerf all AP junglers and not the champion abusing the item (punish the victim, that's real smart)
2) This isn't the first time this has happened. Back in Season 3 the item Spirit of the Elder Lizard was nerfed because our favorite skill shot ADC brought it into lane and abused it. 

I am serious, Ezreal abuses every decent on-hit item into the ground after they are released. I can bet money that AD Ezreal would be the next fad looking at the new Warrior Jungle Enchantment. I don't want to sound like I am ranting but there is always a pattern. Riot makes a strong On-Hit item, Ezreal abuses it, Riot nerfs it to near useless. Wince, Repeat.

If they didn't want this stuff brought to lane they wouldn't make it so unique. You never see the current warrior enchant brought into lane because if you want that kind of item you can buy {{item:3142}}, which has the same kind of stats but doesn't require you to sacrifice a summoner. If they didn't want cinderhulk in lane they could've just not put the +%health and instead made it a jungler's {{item:3068}}.

By making these jungle items unique Riot is saying that this item is for anyone who can take advantage of it, junglers and laners who think that it's worth it even without the jungle specific bonuses. The simplest solution to preventing laners from using these items is to give them non-jungle counterparts which can be balanced seperately, but they aren't which means that either Riot is stupid (certainly possible though I'd prefer to think otherwise), or taking smite into lane is intended behavior that they are trying to make balanced.

You asked that question in my thread on fixing laners taking jungle items, and I'll copy and paste my response here so others can see it:

> Junglers don't get the same level of gold as a laner does, but at the same time they need to hit their big powerspikes early on so they can keep up with the laners, and the powerspikes they get come from getting their jungle item, whether it comes on purchase (Warrior and Runeglaive) or comes later on (Cinderhulk and Devourer). The jungle items need to be as efficient as an item that a laner can get, but it has to be cheaper than their items to account for the jungler's lesser income.
> 
> When laners start taking jungle items, it skews this balance in several ways:
> 
> -Laners that get a jungle item will hit their powerspikes a lot earlier than an opponent does, skewing the lane's balance to those that can use the jungle item well (which happened in the top lane Smite meta).
> -Laners getting jungle items will cause the jungler to lose any sort of power spike he gets out of his jungle item because the laners get the same powerspike, but get it earlier
> -If a jungle item gets nerfed so that laners can't abuse it, the junglers that use it will get nerfed more because they have less gold income to buy the jungle items.
> 
> Simply put, when a laner can abuse the jungle items, it creates an environment where the jungler doesn't have the map-wide impact that he needs to have in the mid game.

Notice the restrictions on it? How there isn't an AP equivalent? How there isn't an AD Ranged equivalent?

The Runeglave changes are making similar, although softer, restrictions.

{{item:3025}} does something similar. It gives much more mana, more AP, and armor for only 700g more, plus the AoE damage is a slow field too. On an AP build the waveclear on IBG would fall off compared to Runeglaive, but for the superior stats and CC it offers it should at least be considered a comparable pick for anyone who uses runeglaive, especially outside of the jungle. I don't really have any issue with these nerfs (to the item or to Ez), but it doesn't seem right to me that it would be nerfed because it gives people waveclear when a similar item has done the same thing for awhile and nobody has batted an eye.

Um.... Ezreal DID and abuse {{item:3025}} .  Did you miss the "Blue Ez" craze that was everywhere for a while?  His kit and scalings make nearly any kind of build save full tank ones acceptable on him and he can manage lane without a summoner... even flash, due to his E.  That's why he's so common an abuser of new items.

No I get that, but my point being is that on pretty much any champ that would want Runeglaive IBG is a very similar item that fixes the same issues. I don't play Ez but from what I can tell IBG should be even better on AP Ez than Runeglaive is, since not only does it give better stats but the slow field gives him a small amount of cc, which allows him to at least have _some_ utility outside of sheer damage, and also would make landing his other abilities much easier. There are probably reasons why Runeglaive is a better pick on him that would be more apparent if I played the champ, but my point is that runeglaive getting nerfed because "it gives clear to champs who shouldn't have it" doesn't make sense when a similar item that does the same thing has existed for awhile now.

My guess is that AP Ez isn't getting nerfed because of his synergy with Runeglaive making him OP, he's getting nerfed because runeglaive made him get popular and brought to light some of his issues that Riot was able to ignore before. I don't believe that runeglaive is responsible for making AP Ez "broken" (I don't think he's broken but that's a different issue), and their plan to pigeonhole it into the jungle feels unnecessary.
He isn't the "only" but he is the biggest offender as of right now. And of course it would help Diana, it was practically made for Jungle Diana so Mid Diana was sure to be able to use it.

AP Udyr still has a extremely high damage output late game with a Runeglaive, wave-clear aside, being able to do 1500~ damage in a first hit R with a Ludens (Udyr can proc it If I remember.) 

All thought much less under the radar, big offenders are Udyr and Ezreal with Runeglaive.

Uydr can't afford to be a glass cannon, which if you're building Runeglave you're most likely going to be. Uydr dealing 1.5 K damage in one auto doesn't matter for the same reason straight AP Sejuani's W dealing 50% of your HP doesn't matter, neither of them can reach you without dying.

Thing is, high AP Udyr can make shift tank and create picks, his E and W can get him to you, unless you are Vayne or Kalista, you will struggle to shred him down before he picks you off with his nuke(r) It takes hard CC that he can easily counter by being Map Aware and spamming E  and W to get away from a 1v2 situation.

Technically this isn't too big of a nerf.

Ezreal was really the only champ that was looking for the AoE proc in PVP combat. Everyone else either looked for the single-target proc, didn't look for the proc in the first place, or only looked for the proc on jungle monsters (which is more the case for non-meta AP junglers that need the mana regen from Runeglaive that don't normally jungle).

Of course, it doesn't change the fact that Runeglaive still isn't that great of an item. What it does is that it expands the jungle champion pool to include those that can jungle well but don't have the mana sustain to do it, but then shrinks it to those that can jungle, use a sheen proc well, AND cannot go into a solo lane (where you'd just get Lich Bane instead), or those that can jungle fine without a jungle item.

Of course Ezreal is going to abuse the new Warrior too, and I made a thread talking about how to keep laners like Ezreal from abusing the jungle items. If anyone's interested, you can find the thread right here: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/4M372eyq-how-to-fix-laners-taking-jungle-items

Most AP junglers either don't need the item, can get another jungle item that is also good, or need the item but can't use it in PVE combat, and in that situation it isn't getting hit too hard.

And this is why off builds shouldn't be kept around anymore. If they gutted all his ratios a while back, this wouldn't even be a discussion we are having. They killed ap trist, they killed ad malph, one can only hope ap ezreal is next on that list.

AP Trist was fine, I would argue she was the perfect example of an off build. ADC trist is supposed to be a safe, easy to use, carry who specializes in shredding targets from long range and using her abilities to keep that distance between her and her targets.  AP trist was a super risky build that used her abilities to blow up targets by jumping on top of them and blowing them up. Their playstyles are like the antithesis of one another and a perfect example of a single kit being used very differently based on build path. 

Not only was it a great example of what Riot should work for in off builds, but it was super easy to make its power scale separately from her AD build path since her AD carrying was never really dependent on the damage that her abilities did, whereas her AP path was. This meant that nerfs/buffs to the utility of her abilities hurt her AD build more, whereas nerfs/buffs to the AP ratios would change the AP build without affecting the AD build at all.

But my point is you can't risk having off builds in the game. What if with some new ap item it made ap trist obscenely broken. Just hitting raw ap scalings may not be enough, you'd need to reduce cds on her w or e or ult, which would have negative effects on her adc power. It's easier and better to just not have them in the game, to prevent things like this from happening.

If somehow there was no way to balance it, you could just kill it by either removing or gutting the scalings that allow for it. I do think that the original build is the one that should be preserved for competitive balance. If there is a way to allow for a secondary build in the same kit it should be encouraged though, because it's basically getting two champs for the price of one which is good for Riot and the players.

But it poses potential threats like this ezreal. For months ap ezreal was considered bad because of his weak early game. And yea, NOW they are nerfing him. But having him run around like this for two patches isn't ideal. It's such a massive risk. Imagine if this happened closer to worlds, it wouldn't be so great.

AP Ez isn't even that strong though, fixing his early game made him a good midlane pick, but he wasn't a god tier pick, didn't break the game, and wasn't auto-win. The only reason he was strong at all is his ult did a lot of damage at very long range, but that was like his only trick. He offered no utility to his team when behind since he has no cc, and he doesn't have good waveclear. Even if he was broken though it wasn't an unforeseeable issue, and should be taken more as an example of the balance team's shortsightedness than as a condemnation of all off builds.

That is not what they were about. 

Both sides of tristana were all about playing risky and the damage on her W emphasized that. They wanted you to wail on an enemy then jump on them and keep wailing on them. It just so happened it was also really good at keeping enemies away. The difference is in the way they did it. 

AD trist was all about whittling them down to jump on them and kill them.

AP trist was just dropping your E jumping and then Ulting them for the kill.

AD trist was sustained where as AP was about burst.

Both however were designed to be reckless.

You know what bothers me most about smite ez. Well let me get into detail. So remember when before smite laners was a thing us junglers were complaining about laners taking our camps because they were litteraly wasting 30 gold off the planet of the rift every time they took a camp. Well now we can't even say that because they can go and take our camps and all we can do is just say like ... Y you steal my camp w/ smite?

They changed it so the AoE doesn't proc on non-monsters and made it so it doesn't come convert your autos into magic damage, but Ezreal was only abusing that last part because it made his Q work with his magic pen. The AoE should remain, because that way Ezreal chooses Lich Bane for better single target burst, or takes smite for the weaker AoE Sheen proc.

You guys are forgetting the biggest issue with Runeglaive. It's the fact that it was unintentionally procing non on hit effects, this made it good on AP ez cause his Q could proc Ludens, which removed a huge weakness from his kit. Now that it doesn't proc Ludens on abilities that apply on hit effects, I see no reason to nerf him or the converting to magic damage part. If they code the item auto itself to not proc Ludens all would be fine.
Is it really so hard to make the effect go off on monsters and champions ONLY... solves the wave clear problem.

It was supposed to help AP champs clear the jungle, not farm lanes and splitpush. It's true that giving AP Ezreal cheap and reliable AoE damage in lane is a problem, but Runeglaive was never intended to do that for ANYONE.

Still, I'd like to see it do SOMETHING unique that Lich Bane doesn't, and aiding jungle clears or 10% CDR just isn't that. Cinderhulk multiplies bonus health, Devourer is...well, Devourer, and now Warrior is getting on-damage burn. Runeglaive will now feel more than ever like a mini Lich Bane. That's boring, not to mention slot-inefficient. Maybe if the AoE triggered when attacking monsters or champions, but not minions...

I wouldn't call Runglaive an On-hit item. {{item:3726}} / {{item:3933}} is an on-hit item, and I believe that Spirit of the Elder Lizard proc'ed on physical damage, not just AA?

I'd agree that Ez abuses a lot of items, but it's not unique to jungle items. His Q is a short CD, high damage, long range AA which scales with both AP and AD all of which meaning it synergizes really well with anything that it can possibly proc, which is a lot due to its unique nature. Spellblades, some on-hits, physical damage, all can be proced by his Q and most of those were never meant to be spammed at long range ({{item:3025}} ). I think his Q is a really cool and unique move, but it's going to abuse a lot of stuff by design and I think that Riot needs to change how it interacts with items, either as a whole or on a case by case basis.
